data.text:
#INCYMI: @KGeorgieva & @JanetYellen  talk about the progress women have made in the profession of economics. There are still too few women around the table, but it is wonderful to see the improvement. #ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021

▶️ Watch here: https://t.co/mbUIcvSR9U https://t.co/8x9uBEfsB3
.@KGeorgieva: At the IMF we walk the talk on #ClimateAction. How? Watch the video to find out https://t.co/MAoEXgcoLw

STARTING NOW: Join @UniofOxford economist @carlbfrey for an in-depth look at the history of technological progress and how it radically shifted the distribution of economic and political power among members of society.
https://t.co/CwduiM3zc4 #FutureOfWork https://t.co/0UzYa5fkAo

🔘STARTING NOW🔘: 

Join @KGeorgieva for her take on the global recovery and countries’ work to build a more resilient future 🌎🍃.
https://t.co/B7d1rwSXmf
 
#GreenRecovery
 
@UniofOxford @UNEP @OxEconRecovery https://t.co/Agf30KqdDZ

In October 2020, The Bahamas leapfrogged into the digital vanguard with the launch of the world’s first central bank digital currency—the sand dollar. Learn more in the latest issue of #FandD: https://t.co/lW8qGLDJm2 #fintech https://t.co/sR1OEDCeRm

How can countries use recovery spending to accelerate the transition to a new #ClimateEconomy?
 
Join us tomorrow, March 10 at 9:30am EST for a live @UniofOxford / @UNEP panel discussion feat. @KGeorgieva
 
https://t.co/aBazdHclWu https://t.co/IwXGjH678k

Technology can help usher in a period of shared growth after the pandemic – if we shape it in a way that creates jobs and spurs inclusive growth. https://t.co/bZ9qfAig4a #FandD https://t.co/vv4GJikaEs
Our latest #IMFBlog shows the most common ways governments in 130 countries supported cash-strapped small businesses during COVID-19. https://t.co/M0JlEozFCq https://t.co/DKBFjr47hS

.@JanetYellen and @KGeorgieva celebrate #InternationalWomensDay with this conversation about their personal journeys and overcoming gender biases in economics. 

🎧Listen to their conversation in latest @imf_podcast https://t.co/Qk8nnIl5B1 https://t.co/xf3pN0miUH

“Are we building back better?” This is the question for global leaders including @KGeorgieva during a @UniofOxford and @UNEP panel discussion this Wednesday March 10 at 9:30 AM EST. Join the livestream: https://t.co/aBazdHclWu #GreenRecovery https://t.co/OsB5Y13IHZ

#AI and automation: should we be concerned about the #FutureofWork? This Wednesday, @UniofOxford economist Carl Benedikt Frey shares his perspectives on the impact of automation on employment.
https://t.co/O2amVwBKqz
 
#IMFinnovation https://t.co/5Co2oHY3oc

As countries prepare for the recovery, it will be critical for governments to monitor policy measures to support small businesses affected by the pandemic. Read more in the latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/M0JlEozFCq https://t.co/Wxse2GaUBQ

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath writes in the latest issue of #FandD that it will take a greater combined push of the scientific and medical community, governments, and multilateral institutions to avert a great divergence in prospects across countries. https://t.co/JdYhXiIIZD https://t.co/8XCaWDbi0Y

REPLAY: A conversation on women, work, and leadership with IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and U.S. Secretary of the Treasury @JanetYellen in celebration of International Women’s Day. https://t.co/EpHDwGXD43 #IWD2021 https://t.co/nNYFVgQb8e

Are women counted equally in data?  What are the real-world effects of the “male unless indicated otherwise” model of thinking?  Read more in #FandD magazine: https://t.co/JJgtU6cJal #IWD2021 https://t.co/CzNFJuoszH
LIVE: A conversation on women, work, and leadership with @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen. Tune in: https://t.co/fzIQ0dw7RQ #ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021 https://t.co/4zclggQ466

In celebration of #InternationalWomensDay, @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen discuss the impact of the crisis on women and the importance of not losing progress already made on gender equality. #IWD2021 #Womenomics 

Watch the full conversation here: https://t.co/fx9AwQZXiP https://t.co/8S6jW3UBR3

"There simply have to be more women in senior positions." –@KGeorgieva

In celebration of International Women's Day, @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen discuss their journeys & the role of women in economics. https://t.co/nYsgMpvISq  

#Womenomics #IWD2021 #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/Erf7XShFwX

[STARTING NOW] A conversation on women, work, and leadership 
with @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen. 

#ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021 #Womenonmics
https://t.co/4zclgh7FuG
Debt transparency is the key to resolve COVID's global debt crunch. Read the new op-ed by @CeylaP_IMF and @carmenmreinhart https://t.co/AZBFGS9uZa
COVID-19 threatens to roll back gains in women’s economic opportunities, widening gender gaps that persist despite 30 years of progress. https://t.co/sDllkbym35 #IMFBlog https://t.co/ZNheFYHocY
Staying Afloat: New Measures to Support European Businesses - more on #IMFBlog https://t.co/fbIhtPf683 https://t.co/dAfBlBEvuT

As we celebrate International Women’s Day, we consider how to en-gender a recovery for women following the pandemic. Read more in Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh's #IMFBlog https://t.co/0pdTG7DtFi

#IWD2021 #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/dc5fOlBqPU

"With feminist activism, women critique unfair practices, they mobilize nationwide, they push for more egalitarian laws, and demand enforcement. That is absolutely cardinal to gender equality." @_alice_evans  talks to @imf_podcast https://t.co/Mgw3NjQGfq https://t.co/k4how4HsJz

Digitalization can transform economies and lives. But it needs to be inclusive with a focus on regulation, investment in digital skills and infrastructure. Our latest issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/NDa2O2URc2

Economics has always impacted women’s daily lives. And in this pandemic, women all over the world have borne the brunt of the economic and social impact. https://t.co/fsumVqKJu8 #ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021 https://t.co/7mJ9QLlJe9

At the Forbes Women Africa 2021 Leading Women Summit, Chief Economist @GitaGopinath will join @METHILRENUKA for a one-on-one conversation on the devastating impact of the COVID-19 crisis on women. https://t.co/nFgnWYRHPo #IWD2021

📅 March 8 @ 8:10 AM ET (3:10 PM CAT) . https://t.co/XpIbGIa4yx
“The Age of #Womenomics” – watch a 1-on-1 conversation with @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen tomorrow March 8 at 10am EST https://t.co/fzIQ0dNJgq #ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021 https://t.co/UQh5Mv3S7q

Targeted policies can help mitigate the scarring impact on #tourism workers, particularly #youth and #women who are disproportionately affected by the pandemic.  https://t.co/bgHxaCmReg https://t.co/YFiZvj9Udx

#Indonesia suffered less from the pandemic than other Asia-Pacific countries, due to less stringent lockdowns and lower dependence on tourism. The country now has the firepower to boost its recovery. Technology can help usher in a period of shared growth after the pandemic – if we shape it in a way that creates jobs and spurs inclusive growth. https://t.co/bZ9qfAzQVI #FandD https://t.co/AhBQ1zZZxg

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath will deliver the keynote at the inaugural Dr. Hansa Mehta Memorial Dialogue, on "Women's Economic Empowerment and Inclusive Global Economic Growth: COVID-19 and Beyond."

#DYK that having more women leaders in the #fintech industry is linked to better performance of fintech firms? #ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021 https://t.co/fsumVqKJu8 https://t.co/x9garfOmh1

Women have borne the economic and social brunt of the pandemic. Our new #IMFBlog by Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh shows national budgets are a powerful tool governments can bring to bear on gender inequalities. #IWD2021 https://t.co/0pdTG7DtFi https://t.co/y4yRhzDILe

The Spring 2021 issue of #FandD focuses on our digital future, exploring how we can redirect technology to spur more jobs, greater productivity, and a more equally shared form of economic prosperity. Find it here: https://t.co/bZ9qfAig4a https://t.co/YdHtnjklYc

"There is, at any given time, a small number of incredibly talented individuals that have exceptionally high ability to produce groundbreaking ideas." @_RuchirAgarwal on embracing the gift of global talent.  

🎧Listen to latest @imf_podcast  https://t.co/FyFFV6vIbt https://t.co/5lgmOjYnYb

More women in executive positions contributes to diversity of thought, which leads to better economic decision-making. This #IWD2021 watch @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen in a conversation about the “The Age of Womenomics.” Tune in March 8 at 10 am EST https://t.co/fzIQ0dNJgq https://t.co/OFfGlE6sTE

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath weighs in on the stimulus debate in new #IMFBlog: explains why there is limited risk of persistent high inflation in advanced economies—cites structural factors such as globalization and automation. https://t.co/LqJt4osb2p https://t.co/8W25BBeBVW

Negative interest rates have proven their ability to stimulate economic growth and inflation. Central banks should consider them as part of their toolkit even if they may be unlikely to use it. Read our latest research: https://t.co/EY4sR24oc2 https://t.co/0DrYvLWiDo

In our #WeekendRead we focus on negative interest rates policies, the 9th African Fiscal Forum, our latest issue of F&D magazine on the digital future, podcasts on Indian migration and nurturing global talent, and much more.  https://t.co/ICw3eIdLgB https://t.co/hhWeRaYF99

A new IMF staff study on support measures for European companies estimates that without additional equity support, around 15 million jobs are at risk. Read the #IMFBlog by Alfred Kammer, Director of the European Department. https://t.co/XxB64kyj62 https://t.co/5hTnBwJX2y

The pandemic has accelerated digital adoption worldwide. But digital risks have also increased. Our new issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/JRWWSsS5dA

What’s a taxi riding app to do when a pandemic forces everyone to stay home? In Uganda, @SafeBoda quickly reinvented itself, connecting confined consumers with retailers and services. https://t.co/lW8qGLm7Xs https://t.co/to5alxTyUu

Economics has always impacted women’s daily lives. And in this pandemic, women all over the world have borne the brunt of the economic and social impact. https://t.co/fsumVqKJu8 #ChooseToChallenge #IWD2021 https://t.co/7QoAu5R1yC

"The main goal of #CostaRica’s economic reform program is to boost economic growth and improve income distribution,” states Costa Rica's President @CarlosAlvQ in an interview with #IMFCountryFocus: https://t.co/bix0MV4ShB https://t.co/3shkujsqkX

Two leaders of the global economy sit down to discuss equity in economics, what can be done to encourage more women to enter the field and share their personal career journeys. Watch @KGeorgieva & @JanetYellen March 8 @ 10am EST https://t.co/fzIQ0dNJgq #Womenomics #IWD2021 https://t.co/Ja31Ootef1

Financial technology—fintech—opens opportunities, especially for financial inclusion, but policymakers must also address the risks. Learn more about the IMF’s work on this issue in the latest Annual Report.  https://t.co/9HJcrIo8Tu https://t.co/Ymv9d1WNWm
To mark International Women’s Day, four steps to ensure budgets are built with women in mind. https://t.co/0pdTG7DtFi #IMFBlog #IWD2021 https://t.co/Ewk1khJoRv

#Indonesia responded to the pandemic with a strong recovery plan, spending almost 4% of GDP to strengthen health care and provide financial support to people and businesses. It proved crucial in preventing a deeper downturn.  https://t.co/zIVfT0eabw #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/Mddld4miCh

#Indonesia suffered less from the pandemic than other Asia-Pacific countries, due to less stringent lockdowns and lower dependence on tourism. The country now has the firepower to boost its recovery. In celebration of International Women’s Day, @KGeorgieva and @JanetYellen sit down for a conversation on the “The Age of Womenomics.” Tune in March 8 at 10 am EST #IWD2021 #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/4zclgh7FuG

Work from home is just not working for many women. Why? 

Because women disproportionately work in the part of the economy hardest hit by the pandemic and tend carry a heavier burden of childcare and domestic chores. #IMFBlog https://t.co/QE0TFaVjEF https://t.co/2gpy3KNb9i

The pandemic disrupted Sri Lanka’s historic tea industry, as live tea auctions could no longer be held. Technology helped update a 125-year old tradition in a matter of days, saving a vital economic sector. https://t.co/lW8qGLm7Xs https://t.co/32xyKOoiLd
Last week's #G20 meeting put Special Drawing Rights in the news.  How can this way to boost countries’ reserves help? Find our more https://t.co/OZmwfOSks6 https://t.co/bogDSuJkj3
What impact do central banks’ negative interest rates have on the economy? Read our latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/qsrs09H76N #NIRP

Digitalization can transform economies and lives. But it needs to be inclusive with a focus on regulation, investment in digital skills and infrastructure. Our latest issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/edRy6c8awj

If and when countries move ahead with an official digital currency, they should seek to reproduce today’s winning combination of central bank currency’s safety and stability with private sector’s innovation and diversity. https://t.co/Ogkz0ctCcN #IMFBlog https://t.co/6WQGPtm4fV

The evidence so far shows that negative interest rates help credit flow to the economy without significant side effects. Read more in the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/RnMWyOcDqN #NIRP https://t.co/pAJPGeMIza

Negative interest rates have proven their ability to stimulate economic growth and inflation. Central banks should consider them as part of their toolkit even if they may be unlikely to use it. Read our latest research: https://t.co/EY4sR24oc2 #NIRP https://t.co/aa7v3YdYII

The pandemic has accelerated digital adoption worldwide. But digital risks have also increased. Our new issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/zDCRS6jJnd

Central banks’ negative interest rates helped credit flow to the economy and support growth and inflation.  But they are often misunderstood and remain controversial. Read the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/wzKKBNKmDA #NIRP https://t.co/FjrjulNKn0
Did government support in your country help reduce job losses last year? https://t.co/JJ1maKyz4J #poll
In October 2020, The Bahamas leapfrogged into the digital vanguard with the launch of the world’s first central bank digital currency—the sand dollar. https://t.co/lW8qGLm7Xs https://t.co/lu7TKY4ZpJ

#IMFCountryFocus spoke with #CostaRica’s President @CarlosAlvQ, about building consensus on fiscal efforts, boosting innovation, and becoming a net-zero emissions economy by 2050. Read the full interview: https://t.co/bix0MV4ShB https://t.co/3SImQQzS14

REPLAY: Opening session of the #AfricanFiscalForum with @KGeorgieva, @JuttaUrpilainen, @AmbMuchanga, Vera Daves de Sousa, @AmadouHott, and Tidjane Thiam. https://t.co/7d5QFA063X https://t.co/DsobOQi00Z

What will the role of automation be in the post-COVID world? And how will these changes affect economic growth and widening inequality? Read “Remaking the Post-COVID World” by @MIT’s @DrDaronAcemoglu in #FandD’s new Spring 2021 issue:  https://t.co/FT2AMZZwUm https://t.co/AQfwgaUr2Z

.@KGeorgieva on three lessons from the COVID-19 crisis:
1️⃣ The crisis has hit vulnerable countries the hardest
2️⃣ The crisis is an opportunity for transformation
3️⃣ We are in this together
https://t.co/JyAjp3aDQQ #AfricanFiscalForum https://t.co/EogoJ9nhuD

'Nothing can be put in the category of impossible anymore.' At the #AfricanFiscalForum, @KGeorgieva called for bold actions to help build a vibrant, competitive, and resilient Africa. https://t.co/7d5QFA063X https://t.co/YieJl2Ve5Y

#Tunisia was hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, its economy contracted by 8.2% in 2020. Poverty and unemployment rates rose, especially among women and youth. What can be done to ensure a durable recovery? Watch the video and Read the report https://t.co/1rwivvQFbk https://t.co/M5eAJshixe

.@KGeorgieva and @JuttaUrpilainen issued a joint statement at the start of the 9th #AfricanFiscalForum calling for policies to help sub-Saharan Africa address the unprecedented health, social and economic crisis. https://t.co/JyAjp3aDQQ

A new IMF staff study on support measures for European companies estimates that without additional equity support, around 15 million jobs are at risk. Read the new #IMFBlog by Alfred Kammer, Director of the European Department. https://t.co/XxB64kyj62 https://t.co/TLEdZbM0EK

LIVE NOW: Opening session of the African Fiscal Forum with @KGeorgieva, @JuttaUrpilainen, @AmbMuchanga, Vera Daves de Sousa, @AmadouHott, and Tidjane Thiam. https://t.co/7d5QFA063X #AfricanFiscalForum https://t.co/xumQHdXHIV

Read more on IMF lending and the Extended Fund Facility here: https://t.co/FlZPiiPCan

IMF Executive Board approves a 36-month US$1.778 billion extended arrangement under the Extended Fund Facility to help support #CostaRica's recovery and stabilize its economy. https://t.co/W1GbrbNcTG https://t.co/dlrKkcmBce

Technology can help usher in a period of shared growth after the pandemic – if we shape it in a way that creates jobs and spurs inclusive growth. https://t.co/bZ9qfAig4a #FandD https://t.co/RCvtTDQJHY

The Spring 2021 issue of #FandD launches today, and focuses on our digital future, exploring how we can redirect technology to spur more jobs, greater productivity, and a more equally shared form of economic prosperity. Find it here: https://t.co/bZ9qfAig4a https://t.co/SjpCsyHweG

By the end of 2022, cumulative per capita income loss (relative to pre-pandemic trend) will be significantly greater in low-income countries than in advanced economies. https://t.co/AXma0eS51X #IMFBlog https://t.co/y0RykAnug0

As advanced economies recover faster from the COVID-19 crisis, there is a risk that most sub-Saharan African countries will face weak recoveries for years to come. Fiscal actions and international support can help bridge the gap. https://t.co/tW9f3cEd0V #AfricanFiscalForum https://t.co/NyqzGnRH6i
The diverging recoveries are set to worsen the human tragedy of the pandemic and the economic suffering of the most vulnerable. Here is why: https://t.co/JJ1maKyz4J #IMFBlog https://t.co/KXfbTRdzU3
Care about our planet? 🌍 So do we. Learn about the IMF’s work on climate. Follow us! https://t.co/nAjsuxp2ji

With social distancing and health and hygiene protocols likely to remain in place, touchless service delivery and investments in digital technology could help the tourism industry recover. #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/YffZJNjmcM https://t.co/WNsgoHbahy

Did fiscal support in 2020 help people because it cut job losses?

Yes – Comparing countries we show how more sizable crisis support was often associated with a smaller loss in employment. https://t.co/VyVol9UFKG #IMFBlog https://t.co/lZv7Vkcz78

🗓 @KGeorgieva, @JuttaUrpilainen, @AmbMuchanga, Vera Daves de Sousa, @AmadouHott and Tidjane Thiam will open the #AfricanFiscalForum on March 2 at 8:00 AM ET. Watch live: https://t.co/fggET6LITX https://t.co/xumQHdXHIV

African countries reacted swiftly to the COVID-19 crisis, allowing economies to reopen relatively quickly. The #AfricanFiscalForum on Tuesday, March 2 at 8:00 AM ET will discuss the prospects and ideas to overcome the challenges to recovery. Watch LIVE: https://t.co/7d5QFA063X https://t.co/p6fSD5B8jl
